entries.content: Built BlogLog from the smallest germ of an idea to fully complete AI integrated tool in about 3 hours, including a break to watch TV

entries.summary: This development conversation accomplished building BlogLog, a meta-tool for documenting development work in real-time, using Claude Code as the primary development approach. Key decisions made include: using a CLI-first design that wraps git commits (`bl commit` replaces `git commit -m`), implementing a Next.js web interface for longer captures and timeline viewing, storing data in JSON files for simplicity, and designing for zero-friction habit formation in the developer workflow. The project serves as both a practical documentation tool and a learning vehicle for Claude Code, with the meta-aspect of using BlogLog to document its own creation being a central theme throughout development.

entries.message: fix timeline display for conversation entries and add tags

entries.summary:
This development conversation focused on learning Claude Code by building "BlogLog" - a meta-tool for documenting development in real-time. The key accomplishment was successfully creating a working CLI and web application that captures development timelines (commits, notes, breakthroughs, blockers) and generates blog posts using AI. Major decisions included using a CLI-first approach that wraps git commits for zero-friction adoption, storing data in JSON files for git-friendliness, and building multi-project support where each project gets its own `.bloglog/` directory.

The most interesting insight was the recursive nature of the project - using BlogLog to document building BlogLog itself, which validated the tool's design in real-time and demonstrated Claude Code's capability to scaffold a complete project (CLI tool + Next.js web interface) in about 90 minutes through natural language direction.
